title: How to Make Hidden Folders and Files on Your Computer

steps.title: Right-click your desktop.
steps.content: Right-click your desktop. You'll need to create a regular file here first.

steps.title: Hover over "New".
steps.content: Hover over "New".

steps.title: Click a file type.
steps.content: Click a file type. "Folder" or "Text Document" are quick and simple choices.

steps.title: Type in a name for your folder.
steps.content: Type in a name for your folder.

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Right-click your file.
steps.content: Right-click your file.

steps.title: Click Properties.
steps.content: Click Properties .

steps.title: Check the "Hidden" box.
steps.content: Check the "Hidden" box.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Your file is now hidden, meaning it won't show up in search queries or your File Explorer app; however, if you create a regular folder in the same directory with the same name, it will rename itself to be "Filename (2)", which betrays the fact that you have a hidden folder in that directory. Your file is also literally invisible unless your computer is currently displaying hidden files and folders.

steps.title: Type "hidden files" into the Start search bar.
steps.content: Type "hidden files" into the Start search bar.

steps.title: Click "Show hidden files and folders".
steps.content: Click "Show hidden files and folders". This should be the first item in the search list.

steps.title: Double-click "Hidden files and folders".
steps.content: Double-click "Hidden files and folders". If this option already shows two sub-options indented below it, skip this step.

steps.title: Click "Show hidden files, folders, and drives".
steps.content: Click "Show hidden files, folders, and drives".

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: Close the "Hidden files" menu.
steps.content: Close the "Hidden files" menu.

steps.title: Return to your desktop.
steps.content: Return to your desktop. You should now see your previously-hidden file! It will appear transparent to indicate its "hidden" attribute. To hide your files again, return to the "Hidden files and folders" menu and click "Don't show hidden files, folders, or drives".

steps.title: Two-finger click your desktop.
steps.content: Two-finger click your desktop. You'll need to use the "Terminal" app to hide your folder.

steps.title: Click New Folder.
steps.content: Click New Folder .

steps.title: Type in a name for your folder.
steps.content: Type in a name for your folder.

steps.title: Tap ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Tap ⏎ Return .

steps.title: Click the magnifying glass icon.
steps.content: Click the magnifying glass icon. This is in the top right corner of your screen. You can also hold ⌘ Command and tap Spacebar .

steps.title: Type in "Terminal".
steps.content: Type in "Terminal".

steps.title: Tap ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Tap ⏎ Return .

steps.title: Type chflags hidden.
steps.content: Type chflags hidden .

steps.title: Drag your folder into Terminal.
steps.content: Drag your folder into Terminal.

steps.title: Tap ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Tap ↵ Enter . Your folder should now be hidden from view! [1] X Research source Hidden folders on a Mac are invisible unless you type a specific command into Terminal.

steps.title: Click Go.
steps.content: Click Go . This is in your screen's top right corner tool bar.

steps.title: Click Go to Folder.
steps.content: Click Go to Folder .

steps.title: Type in ~/Desktop/(FolderName).
steps.content: Type in ~/Desktop/(FolderName) .

steps.title: Click Go.
steps.content: Click Go . You should now be viewing your folder's contents! Any files you place in your folder will also be hidden.
